channel.title: Events
channel.description: What's happening at the University of Newcastle.

item.title: Caroline Zilinsky: Exquisite Cadaver Exhibition
item.description: Caroline Zilinsky belongs in a time other than now; deciphering the present and foretelling the future. The artist’s gift is awareness and the courage to paint the uncomfortable. The mirror she places in front of us is a powerful reminder that art is much more than just about liking things.

item.title: From Pen to Press
item.description:
A University Library Exhibition
Women have consistently engaged in all aspects of the modern book trade. This exhibition shines a light on women's myriad contributions using the Library's holdings to showcase women's work in the Australian book trade from the mid-nineteenth century to the present day

item.title: Wh!p Collective Stories of Light
item.description: Stories of Light presents WH!P’s anthology of lens-based stories devised around a sense of place, the personal, the familial and the inspirational. These tales from visual artists are told through the medium of photography, akin to the written words of authors.

item.title: General Practitioner Radiation Oncology Education Evening
item.description: Join us for a FREE interactive, educational evening at the University of Newcastle’s Global Centre for Research and Training in Radiation Oncology.

item.title: Campus Tours Saturday Callaghan
item.description: Come and explore the vibrant atmosphere of the University of Newcastle's Callaghan Campus. This in-person event is a fantastic opportunity to get a firsthand experience of our beautiful campus.

item.title: Storytelling for Scientists
item.description: No matter what your field of research you need to be able to craft a narrative around your work: what you do, why you do it, and who’ll benefit from it.

item.title: Jobs on Campus Info Session - Administration Assistant (Finance)
item.description: The University is looking for a current student to join the Financial Services team as an Administration Assistant. In this online information session we will provide details about the position and tips on how to submit a high-quality application.

item.title: Startup Stories - Rachel Sperinck (PAH! App)
item.description: Hear the experiences of an entrepreneur and business owner – the highs, the lows, the wins, the mistakes, the inside story.

item.title: SIMON MUNRO: Philosophies of the Anaiwan Exhibition
item.description: Australia’s Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander nations boast a rich history of creative expressions (cultural practice), serving to preserve identities through storytelling, painting song, dance, wood and rock carving. Philosophies of the Anaiwan draws from Munro’s heritage, the Anaiwan nation of the New England Tablelands.

item.title: Parents and Carers Info Session - Central Coast
item.description: Join us at the Central Coast Clinical School for an opportunity to hear from university staff and current students, to assist you in supporting your child through their transition from high school to university.

item.title: BiG Day In
item.description: BiG Day In events are for year 9-12 school students to explore careers in technology. Students interact with to 7-8 sessions covering career paths, career opportunities, the latest developments, and the future of technology.

item.title: Semester Exchange in Sem 1, 2025 info session
item.description: If you're hoping to go on exchange in Semester 1, 2025, join this zoom info session to find out everything you need to know, including how to choose the right location, when to apply, how to increase your chances of getting your first preference location, and the Semester Exchange process.

item.title: PD+Base: LinkedIn for Professionals and Researchers
item.description: A very popular webinar fiving you a practical guide to amplifying your presence and impact through LinkedIn.

item.title: Job Application Bootcamp
item.description: Are your job application documents working for you? Writing an effective resume, cover letter or statement addressing the selection criteria can be a tricky process! Come along to this bootcamp we will set you in the right direction to develop a standout job application.

item.title: Startups or Stuffups?
item.description: Explore real startup stories and decide: Success or Failure?

item.title: Parents and Carers Info Session – Newcastle
item.description: Join Newcastle Parents and Carers for an evening to hear from university staff and current students, covering a range of different topics to assist you in supporting your chiild through their transition from high school to university.

item.title: HSC Music Day 2024
item.description: HSC Music Day returns to the Con in 2024 with a fantastic program for music students.

item.title: Combined Choirs Concert
item.description: Join us for an inspiring afternoon of choral music in this memorable performance.

item.title: DJ Comp 2024
item.description: We're on the hunt to find DJ talent on campus at The University of Newcastle's 2024 DJ Comp! Beginners to experts are welcome, and students of all gender orientations! You don’t have to be studying music or know anything about DJing to enter. Plus DJ decks are provided! The heats and finals are on the below dates:

item.title: Neurodivergent Peer to Peer Program: Procrastination and Perfectionism Workshop
item.description: Join us for a workshop designed specifically for neurodivergent students. Together, we'll explore practical strategies to overcome procrastination and perfectionism.

item.title: Exercise Sport Science & Exercise Physiology Industry Day
item.description: The Exercise Sport Science & Physiology Industry Day is the perfect opportunity to engage with employers, businesses, and alumni in the Exercise Sport Science, and Exercise Physiology fields.

item.title: Research Integrity Roundtable 2: Research Data
item.description: Join us for a roundtable discussion on all things related to Research Data.

item.title: BOOK LAUNCH: Agency and Ownership in Reconciliation by Caitlin Mollica
item.description: Join us in person or online to Launch Caitlin Mollica's book Agency and Ownership in Reconciliation.

item.title: Global Experience Scholarships info session
item.description: If you'd love to go overseas as part of your degree, and need some funding to get you there, join this zoom info session to find out what scholarships/grants/loans are available to you!

item.title: PD+Health: IP and data integrity - getting it right from the start
item.description: In this workshop, we will discuss the different types of intellectual property, when and how to consider protecting it, and how to go about doing this. Specific topics will include:*What is IP?*Different types of IP*When and when not to file patents

item.title: Brilliantly Bad Pitch Competition
item.description: Explore brilliantly bad ideas, refine pitches, compete, and network in a fun-filled event celebrating unconventional creativity!

item.title: JMP Info Session Webinar
item.description: Join us for an info session to hear from Joint Medical Program academics and current students about the program, admission requirements and much more.

item.title: Welcome Week - Trimester 2
item.description: Welcome Week is a program of social and academic activities designed to introduce new students to life and study at the University of Newcastle. Held before classes start, Welcome Week makes the transition to university life easier. Please see the below event dates for each campus:

item.title: Campus Tours Callaghan
item.description: Come and explore the vibrant atmosphere of the University of Newcastle's Callaghan Campus in Australia. This in-person event is a fantastic opportunity to get a firsthand experience of our beautiful campus.

item.title: Campus Tours Ourimbah
item.description: Whether you are a prospective student, a parent or carer, or simply curious about the university experience, this tour is an ideal way to get a firsthand look at everything Ourimbah Campus has to offer.

item.title: Campus Tours Central Coast Clinical School
item.description: Join us for an exciting in-person tour of the Central Coast Clinical School! This event is a fantastic opportunity to explore our state-of-the-art facilities and learn more about the cutting-edge medical education and research happening on campus.

item.title: Campus Tours NUspace
item.description: Join a tour of NUspace. You'll have the opportunity to discover the latest technologies, interactive classrooms, and collaborative study areas that make NUspace a hub of creativity and learning. Our knowledgeable staff will be available to answer any questions you may have.

item.title: Campus Tours Q Building
item.description: Join us for an exciting tour of the Q Building! Explore the state-of-the-art facilities and immerse yourself in the vibrant campus atmosphere. This in-person event is your chance to discover the cutting-edge technology and innovative spaces that make the Q Building a hub of creativity and learning.

item.title: Social Sciences Industry Day
item.description: The Social Sciences Industry Day is the perfect opportunity to engage with employers, businesses, and alumni in this field. On the day, you will have the chance to ask questions and connect with the top minds in these fields.

item.title: PD+Micro Credentials: Micros as Learning Opportunities: professional learning, skills and employability
item.description: Micros as Learning Opportunities: professional learning, skills and employability. There has been a lot of discussion about micros as potential new pathways to learning and the focus on skills and employability. In this seminar we discuss the challenges of ‘doing learning differently’ and focusing on the needs of the learners and industry.

item.title: Active Learning (NUSpace)
item.description: This workshop will explore teaching techniques to increase student engagement through active learning. During this session you will ascertain the benefits of active learning practice and determine when to employ active learning in the classroom.

item.title: Creative Careers
item.description: If you’re studying media and communication, visual communication design, or music and performing arts, this is a great opportunity to hear about how to carve out a career in the industry. Alumni and industry panellists will share their experience on finding their career path.

item.title: Rubrics Workshop (NUSpace)
item.description: This Rubrics workshop will cover the principles of using rubrics for assessment. Participants will learn how to construct a rubric that will support student learning and increase the efficiency and consistency of marking.

item.title: PD+Base: Identifying and building the commercial potential of your research
item.description: Building on "Intro to Commercialisation", participants will gain a deeper understanding of how they can identify and buildcommercial potential in their research in order to start on a commercialisation pathway, of translating research into a product or service.

item.title: Job Application Bootcamp
item.description: Are your job application documents working for you? Writing an effective resume, cover letter or statement addressing the selection criteria can be a tricky process! Come along to this bootcamp we will set you in the right direction to develop a standout job application.

item.title: Advance HE Fellowship - Preparing an Application
item.description: Advance HE Fellowship application preparation workshop. This workshop will look at Associate Fellow, Fellow and Senior Fellow applications and provide you with tips and suggestions.

item.title: TAFE to Uni Webinar
item.description: Tune in to hear from our admissions staff and student ambassadors that will provide advice and give key insights into studying at the University of Newcastle.

item.title: PD+Base: Identifying Customers, Audiences and Stakeholders for your research and commercialisation
item.description: Participants will be guided through a stakeholder identification matrix which will be valuable regardless of whether they are on acommercialiastion pathway. They will understand the difference between stakeholders, audiences and customers and the messaging requirements for each.

item.title: Rubrics Workshop
item.description: This Rubrics workshop will cover the principles of using rubrics for assessment. Participants will learn how to construct a rubric that will support student learning and increase the efficiency and consistency of marking.

item.title: The Sydney Symphony Orchestra Performs Ngapa William Cooper
item.description: Ngapa William Cooper is a musical tribute to the life of Yorta Yorta activist William Cooper, an Aboriginal activist who played a pivotal role in establishing equal rights for Aboriginal Australians and led the Australian Aborigine’s League protest against the events of Kristallnacht in Nazi Germany.

item.title: Community Strings Concert
item.description: Come along to this Community Music showcase to see our strings students perform in a variety of solo and small group arrangements.

item.title: Stress Less - Semester 1
item.description: Stress Less is back to help you bring this semester to a close with activities, entertainment and strategies to help you cope with and manage stress in the lead up to exams and assessments. Every day we'll bring a different way for you to Stress Less during this busy period, with loads of freebies and activities available in various locations! Check out the

item.title: Rubrics Workshop (Ourimbah)
item.description: This Rubrics workshop will cover the principles of using rubrics for assessment. Participants will learn how to construct a rubric that will support student learning and increase the efficiency and consistency of marking.

item.title: Research Integrity Roundtable 3: Research Supervision and Team Collaboration
item.description: Join us for a roundtable discussion on all things related to Research Supervision and Team Collaboration

item.title: Active Learning - Ourimbah (f2f)
item.description: Explore active learning teaching techniques to increase student engagement. Ascertain the benefits of active learning practice and determine when to employ active learning in the classroom.

item.title: PD+Health: Health Systems Innovation
item.description: Berne Gibbons has been an innovator and change agent whose passion and enthusiasm for health informatics is shaping a new future for Australian healthcare workers.

item.title: Master of Clinical Epidemiology Webinar
item.description: Join Dr Catherine Chojenta to learn more about the Master of Clinical Epidemiology at the University of Newcastle. Gain an understanding of the program and engage in a Q&A.

item.title: Y10 Subject Selection Webinar
item.description: Our student ambassadors will share key subject selection information and share their stories and experiences with subject selection and transition to University studies.

item.title: Reconciliation Ball tickets now on sale
item.description: We are excited to announce the Reconciliation Ball 2024, co-hosted with the College of Engineering, Science, and Environment, which will take place on Thursday 30 May 2024, in the Great Hall, Callaghan.

item.title: HPREP 2 - Health Research Support Services across our Regional Partners – What do I need and where can I access it?
item.description: HPREP 2 - Health Research Support Services across our Partners – What do I need and where can I access it? The University of Newcastle [via Research Advantage] in collaboration with Hunter New England and the Central Coast Local Health District’s will deliver the HPREP

item.title: Neurodivergent Peer to Peer program: Stress Less Workshop
item.description: Join us for an empowering peer to peer workshop tailored specifically for neurodivergent students, to help manage stress effectively.

item.title: Startup Stories - Liam Manning (SAPHI)
item.description: Hear the experiences of an entrepreneur and business owner – the highs, the lows, the wins, the mistakes, the inside story.

item.title: PD+Micro Credentials: What have we learned about development and quality learning in Micros?
item.description: In this seminar we discuss the need for attention to standards and governance in the development and credentialling of micros. Roadblocks and challenges to development and being quick to market will be discussed. Sharing the lived experience of innovators and leaders in this space will add to this story.

item.title: Mid-Year Info Session
item.description: You're invited to join our online info session to find out more about starting your degree in July. There is over 100 mid year undergraduate programs to choose from.

item.title: CMM3 UON Students present: Bands at the Claro
item.description: The University of Newcastle's Bachelor of Music students welcome you to their performance showcase at the Clarendon Hotel!

item.title: PD+Base: A Marketing approach to research commercialisation (Value Proposition)
item.description: Building on Webinar "Audience Identification", participants will learn how to bring together their invention/offering and the potential market to test market response. This webinar is about how you demonstrate that there are customers for your invention.

item.title: Parents and Carers Info Session - Port Macquarie
item.description: Join Port Macquarie Parents and Carers for an evening to hear from university staff and current students, covering a range of different topics to assist you in supporting your chiild through their transition from high school to university.

item.title: PD+Base: How to grow your R&D funding
item.description: Participants will learn practical tips on growing their profile and access to R&D funding, targeted to their career stage, with tips on working effectvely with their research office and case study examples.

item.title: Parents and Carers Info Session - Armidale
item.description: Join Armidale Parents and Carers for an evening to hear from university staff and current students, covering a range of different topics to assist you in supporting your chiild through their transition from high school to university.

item.title: Parents and Carers Info Session - Bathurst
item.description: If you have a child who is currently completing Year 12, come and visit us at Bathurst RSL Club for our Parents and Carers Info Session.

item.title: Nursing and Midwifery Expo (Callaghan)
item.description: Looking for a job in nursing or midwifery? The Nursing and Midwifery Expo is the perfect opportunity to connect with employers and learn more about your future industry and career options.

item.title: PD+Health: Med-tech devices: From design to delivery
item.description: Introduction to the Biodesign Methodology for commercialising Medtech from idea through to commercialisation.

item.title: Group Work Strategies (NUSpace)
item.description: This workshop will cover principles of successful group work, and strategies to enhance collaborative learning in groups for academic success and a greater sense of belonging for our students.

item.title: Parents and Carers Info Session - Tamworth
item.description: Join Tamworth Parents and Carers for an evening to hear from university staff and current students, covering a range of different topics to assist you in supporting your chiild through their transition from high school to university.

item.title: Parents and Carers Info Session - Dubbo
item.description: If you have a child who is currently completing Year 12, come and visit us at Dubbo RSL Club Events Centre for our Parents and Carers Info Session.

item.title: Nursing and Midwifery Expo (Gosford)
item.description: The Nursing and Midwifery Expo will feature employers ready to discuss a range of opportunities. From first to final year of study, it’s always the right time to connect, network, and learn more about the world of careers and employment.

item.title: Parents and Carers Info Session - Mudgee
item.description: Join local Parents and Carers for an evening to hear from university staff and current students, covering a range of different topics to assist you in supporting your chiild through their transition from high school to university.

item.title: Wind Student Recital
item.description: Come along to support the Conservatorium wind students as they showcase their fantastic skills and learnings from their lessons thus far.

item.title: Winter Ball 2024
item.description: A magical Winter is upon us, which makes this the perfect time to present the University of Newcastle’s Winter Ball of 2024! We're inviting all upcoming graduates, current students, as well as alumni to a night of glamour and fun. The evening will also celebrate 50 years of the Open Foundation program building pathways to brighter futures.

item.title: Welcome Week - Semester 2
item.description: Welcome Week is a great opportunity to find out what you need to know about university life and being a University of Newcastle student! It will take place one week before Semester 1 2024 begins.

item.title: Australian Teacher Education Association (ATEA) Conference
item.description: Attend the 2024 ATEA conference at the University of Newcastle City Campus.

item.title: 50 Years-50 Stories Exhibition
item.description: The 50 Years-50 Stories Exhibition showcases 50 former Open Foundation students and shares their stories about the transformative power of the program.

item.title: Graduation - Callaghan
item.description: Congratulations on completing your studies, it’s a milestone achievement and one you deserve to celebrate. Join us on campus with your family and friends to celebrate your achievements.

item.title: 50 Years-50 Stories Exhibition Launch and Book Launch
item.description: The 50 stories that make up this exhibition, and accompanying commemorative book, capture just some of the transformative experiences our students have experienced through Open Foundation.

item.title: Webinar: Master of Midwifery Studies
item.description: Join Dr Lyndall Mollart to learn more about the Master of Midwifery Studies at the University of Newcastle. Gain an understanding of the program and engage in a Q&A.

item.title: PD+Micro Credentials: Thinking outside the box - what does success look like
item.description: In this webinar we will hear about a variety of case studies of success in the development and offerings of micro-credentials. Rethinking micro-credentials will be the focus. What is success in these contexts and cases, and what can we learn from this?

item.title: PD+Base: How to conduct a competitor analysis
item.description: Building on Webinar Market Identification, participants will learn how to identify their own competitive advantage in their market, understand who their competitors are and their strengths and weaknesses, and articulate the barriers to market entry and how to overcome them.

item.title: PD+Base: How to be defence ready
item.description: This webinar will: • Establish an understanding of the Defence sector • Identify avenues and opportunities to work with Defence on research • Show what needs to be in place to work with Defence

item.title: Newcastle Tech Futures
item.description: Do you want to network with some of the most innovative companies our region's tech industry has to offer? Come along to Newcastle Tech Futures to connect, network, and learn more about your future career options.

item.title: PD+Health: Fireside chat with industry expert
item.description: A cozy “Fireside Chat” with Dr Elance Zelcer interviewing an industry expert in Health Commercialisation. Learn from their years of experience and knowledge. Come prepared with Questions.

item.title: Autonomy Day 2024
item.description: This is the biggest party of the year! Autonomy Day is the annual celebration of the University of Newcastle becoming independent from the University of New South Wales in 1965, and it's become a major part of the student experience at the University.

item.title: Opportunities in Banking and Finance
item.description: Come along to this panel discussion to gain insights and advice from industry representatives on careers in banking and finance.

item.title: Central Coast Open Day
item.description: Get a taste of Uni life. Explore our new Central Coast Clinical school in Gosford and our Ourimbah Campus. Chat to current students and academics. Find out more about the degrees you are interesting in studying.

item.title: Band Comp
item.description: Band Comp is back for 2024 and is bigger than ever! Band Comp is open to all students and all genres, with new categories this year for soloists and duos, new bands, as well as established artists. You could win some incredible prizes, including a Recording Package worth $5000 thanks to Sawtooth Studios! The heats and finals are on the below dates:

item.title: Welcome Week - Trimester 3
item.description: Welcome Week is a program of social and academic activities designed to introduce new students to life and study at the University of Newcastle. Held before classes start, Welcome Week makes the transition to university life easier.

item.title: HDR Student Festival
item.description: Higher Degree by Research students are making breakthrough discoveries and solving the world’s most formidable problems. The HDR Student Festival will feature a range of conference-style activities, as well as University-wide events to showcase the excellence and innovation of our HDR cohort.

item.title: 3MT and VYT Finals
item.description:
The 3MT competition final is always a highlight of the HDR calendar. We are delighted that this year our finalists will again be presenting their research in front of a live audience.
Come along and be dazzled by the creative talents of our HDR students while enjoying refreshments throughout the evening.

item.title: Newcastle Open Day
item.description: Get a taste of Uni life. Explore our Newcastle City and Callaghan Campus. Chat to current students and academics. Find out more about the degrees you are interesting in studying.

item.title: Opportunities in International Business and Tourism
item.description: Come along to this panel discussion to gain insights and advice from industry representatives on careers in international business and tourism.

item.title: Allied Health Expo
item.description: Looking for a job or placement opportunity? The Allied Health Expo is the perfect opportunity to connect with employers and learn more about your future industry and career options.
